item.title: Arch Linux Printer Install with CUPS
item.description: I have been using Arch Linux for about 3 years now and only recently I needed to print and scan documents with my office printer (Cannon MF260). Preconfigured Linux distros like Ubuntu, Mint, Manjaro, etc.. already provided you with some functionality to use your printer/scanner. All you need to do is just log in to your favorite DE, search for “printer” in the application launcher, click on the “Add a printer” button and it will magically discover your Wi-Fi wireless or plugged-in printer, install all drivers for that specific printer and… it’s ready for use.
